text: OD Copy Paste External - Special Houdini HDA Edition
Enables you to quickly send Geometry to Houdini and back.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
OD CopyPaste allows you to quickly copy and paste networks from application to another.  The open source version can be found here: https://github.com/heimlich1024/OD_CopyPasteExternal
Copies the current houdini data to the external location.
Receives the data from the external location.
Bundle Externals (Geometry Files / Images / etc - CAREFUL, depending on the # of assets, can be slow)
Packages all the externals as well.  They will be restored in the external Storade dir (by default, in the HIP location / Node Name.
Where you want external files to be stored when pasting from External.

By Default, the temporary file is saved in the %Temp% folder.  You can override this by setting the file handle here.  It is important to note, that Houdini makes its own temp folder within the temp folder, which is why by default this tool is pointing one folder up, so that it matches what other applications have.  You need to make sure if you change it, that other DCC applications access the same path.

The Path, i.e. a network path or a dropbox share so that the copy paste functionality will go beyond the local machine.  This way you can have multiple files for different users/sessions on the same system/network as an example
You also have the ability to use an FTP as temporary exchange
FTP Username to login to the location
The Filename of the temporary shared file.  This way you can have multiple files for different users/sessions on the same FTP as an example

Custom HDA’s are not copied and are assumed to be present in all instances.
Should you get any permission problems, simply remove your houdini_temp folder, restart Houdini and try again.

title: OD Copy Paste External - Special Houdini HDA Edition
summary: Enables you to quickly send Geometry to Houdini and back.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
